law.catch_line: The Board shall place a licensee on inactive status if the licensee submits to the Board:...

section.section:
The Board shall place a licensee on inactive status if the licensee submits to the Board:
An application for inactive status on the form required by the Board; and
The inactive status fee set by the Board.
The Board may not place a licensee on inactive status for more than 6 years.

text.section: The Board shall reactivate a license to an individual who is on inactive status if the individual complies with the renewal requirements that exist at the time the individual changes from inactive to active status.

The Board may not assess the reinstatement fee required under subsection (c) of this section on an individual who has been on inactive status for more than 6 years if the individual can provide documentation of maintaining an active license in another state.

An individual who has been previously licensed by the Board shall obtain a license only by means of license renewal or reinstatement as provided in this article and in regulations adopted by the Board.
